content: I show you my stuff with DM Scotty hey guys have I got a treat for you today I
finished a nude ice tray that I was working on and like the other one I
started out with this hexagonal just wouldnt hexagonal by stray and totally
converted it to have a theme and this times theme is a zombie theme so I love
my zombie games you know hey who doesn't love zombies so i thought i needed i
straight for zombie so i made add ice tray so let's go to the table and I'll
show you how they came out hey guys i'm working on another dice tray and i want
to do is zombie theme this time so here's the dice tray i got it's just a
basic woodend ice tray if you see my monster die stray you've seen this
before so it's going to open it up and then i have a bottom here and i did a
piece of fun I've had a piece of foam to match the bottom so that it won't slide
around also this part comes off so what I'm going to do is put a piece in the in
the center here with room so the top can come back down and I'll pay it a zombie
on that and that should be pretty cool but I want to have it kind of like
ripping flesh and so I will match this to the zombie and the flesh will be kind
of ripping off of it and i've got some gore on the edges so i'll paint that up
come back and show you what it looks like so hey guys here's the cooled ice
tray that i made you can see it looks really good got some gore on the edges
there and like a cement barrier type thing and
then i have the zombie inside chewing and pulling on that flesh that's on the
outside looks like he's really recessed see as the shadow kind of a gulf sim but
that really came out cool I think that really looks neat he chuck some dice in
there so get my zombie side dash check them in there and there we go we got an
ice-cooled ice tray these dice are pretty cool they're like zombie for one
Molotov 46 and then bullet holes for the other digits so I think those are pretty
cool but anyways there we go there's the zombie dice tray I want to talk a little
bit about the technique I should i showed you kind of in the raw state how
I did it but you saw that in the foam I just painted the zombie head on the
phone these gorg patches are just made out of acrylic I just kind of mold
just kind of sculpt the on there with it just a plastic tool I think the
cement came out really nice too i use a little bit of my flexible modeling
medium to put on the edges to cover up the the the construction of the piece
itself because there's it fits on the top and there's there's tendons that fit
in each side so i want to cover those up so i use that but i want to make it look
like concrete so i use it i you putting on much smoother than i normally do I
wasn't trying to go for a rock texture I was trying to go for like concrete I
think it really came out nice I also saw a technique that I could use where I use
spray white and black so I painted it by hand and then sprayed some white black
bonnet give it really a nice coloring and I think that came out really nice
there really looks like concrete so I think that was very successful all right
there we go there's my cool zombie dice tray and I'll see you next time when I
show you my stuff hey crafters I hope you've enjoyed this
episode of the dm's craft make sure to subscribe and I have tons of other
videos as you can see i am the originator of the 2.5 d method of
crafting tiles I also do dirt cheap to rain for the table if all this intrigues
you make sure you check out all the videos below also joined by forum we
have lots of great crafters on there who give advice i have a link above and
below and last but not least remember go forth and draft
you
